conclusion: Wire ABC consists of two segments: AB and BC
Wire AB is in a magnetic field pointing into the page
Wire BC is in a magnetic field pointing out of the page
Both wire segments have length L
Current I flows through the wire
The wire is perpendicular to the magnetic fields
Force on segment AB is calculated as F_AB = ILB
Direction of force on AB is perpendicular to both the current and field
Force on segment BC is calculated as F_BC = ILB
Direction of force on BC is opposite to that of F_AB
Angle between forces F_AB and F_BC is 120°
Magnitude of total force is F_total = sqrt(3) * ILB
Final answer: The magnitude of the Ampere force received by the wire is sqrt(3)ILB
